entry.title: ROSEBURG HAD BELOW NORMAL AMOUNT OF RAIN FOR OCTOBER
entry.summary: November 3, 2025 4:00 a.m. Roseburg had a below normal amount of rain for the month of October. Data from the National Weather Service in Medford said that the Roseburg Regional Airport received 1.83 inches of rain in October. The normal amount of rain for the month is 2.32 inches. entry.title: ROSEBURG HIGH MARCHING ENSEMBLE FNAL PERFORMANCE OF THE YEAR MONDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: November 3, 2025 2:50 a.m. The Roseburg High School Marching Ensemble has its final performance of this school year on Monday night. The group will perform this year’s show, “Cruisin” at their Platinum Arrow event at 8:30 p.m. at Finlay Field on the RHS campus. It is free and open to the public.

entry.title: Umpqua Valley Arts hosts 2025 Members' Exhibit
entry.summary: For artists, the artistic process can be many things: therapeutic, eye-opening, and just plain fun. But sometimes, after days spent away in a studio working away on a piece, it can be lonely.

entry.title: Aviva Health to welcome two new physician associates to Myrtle Creek
entry.summary: In Douglas County’s most rural areas, access to quality healthcare isn’t always a guarantee. But in one community, families may soon be getting a leg up for their medical needs.

entry.title: Annual Leonids meteor shower peaks mid-November
entry.summary: Look tonight, before trick or treating, just after sunset toward the west-southwest horizon to attempt to spy faint Mercury and Mars. Point your binoculars just above the tree tops to spot Mercury. Scan a bit below to find Mars.
